--- Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
> (In JUnit, one way to avoid forgetting is to comment
> out the body of the 
> test, and then assert that the test is being run
> before a particular date. 
> If you do forget, you automatically get a "wake up
> call" when the date is 
> passed)
Good idea. It should solve the problem in some cases.

I'd prefer that these tests are shown in the Eclipse
JUnit view in grey color, which would symbolize:
ignored, but listed. Perhaps there is a trick to do
that. It should work for every major TestRunner, not
just for the one of Eclipse.
